instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.P5VG3S_EN: What is P5VG3S_EN? This signal enables the PP5V_G3S power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP20V_USBC: What is PP20V_USBC? 20 volt power rail that comes directly from the charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No powering on. <SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN</SIGNAL> - 0.0v
threads.message:
Have this board that originally had corrosion damaged and <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC</SIGNAL> was at 5v. Cleaned all up. Replaced <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> and <CHIP>U9580</CHIP>, both were shorted out. Now <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC</SIGNAL> is now at 20v but no current is being pulled. I'm getting 0v @ <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL>.

<SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN</SIGNAL> - 0v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_3V3G3H_T</SIGNAL> - 12.2
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12.2

Any suggestion on where to start on this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No powering on. <SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN</SIGNAL> - 0.0v
threads.message: If you get the AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages, then try DFU restore.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No powering on. <SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN</SIGNAL> - 0.0v
threads.message: Tried DFU restore and just never comes on, causing the DFU to faulted out after a while being stuck in install state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No powering on. <SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN</SIGNAL> - 0.0v
threads.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://mrmacintosh.com/how-to-restore-bridgeos-on-a-t2-mac-how-to-put-a-mac-into-dfu-mode/[/URL]

Did you try as explained here?
Is the best guide at the moment...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No powering on. <SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN</SIGNAL> - 0.0v
threads.message:
Yep. Tried both revive and restore and both gave me the same message. It goes through the install process and just sits there for a while then gives the error. See picture.

[ATTACH type="full"]59506[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No powering on. <SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN</SIGNAL> - 0.0v
threads.message:
I was thinking you cannot access DFU at all.
That guide says sometging about this error, I think.
Search on Internet about that error, may find more information.
